result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance L Buchholtz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lance L Buchholtz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:40 p.m. Defendant Lance L Buchholtz in court with attorney Michael Edward O'Rourke.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty O'Rourke. No statement by DE. Court orders: Ct 1 - 90 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S, Ct 2 - 30 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - Concurrent w/ Ct 1 - I/S -1 year probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.
from Atty O'Rourke requesting adjournment - Granted by the Court
from Atty O'Rourke requesting reschedule of Plea/sentencing hearing

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:04 PM:  Defendant Lance L Buchholtz in court with attorney Michael Edward O'Rourke.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  DA argues for Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection as to bond request.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 09:15 am.
